intro: [WRONG START] Embilia urdanetensis, commonly known as the Andean embelia, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other aromatic plants like eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Embelia urdanetensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
